subdivision_of_building: Part of ground floor and above
description: Conversion of existing (1x4 bedroom) residential flat at first, second and third floor levels into two self-contained flats (1x1 bedroom, 1x2 bedroom) and the retention of a 1 bedroom studio flat to the rear (which was previously lawfully part of the 1x4 bedroom flat at first floor level and part of retail unit at ground floor level) together with new archway access, external staircase and refuse storage at ground floor level at the rear
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Further details including a proposed rear (west) and side (south) elevation and details of the proposed materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.   Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of the development. The approved details shall be implemented in this development prior to the first occupation of any of the residential flats hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note 7: 'Accessible Ealing'. | Details of sound attenuation measures from external noise together with associated ventilation for the proposed residential flats shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note 10: 'Noise and Vibration'. | Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied the developer shall enter into a section 106 agreement with the local planning authority to ensure that any future residents of flats 1 and 3 within the development to form 3 self-contained flats at 70 King Street, Southall shall not be eligible to obtain residents' parking permits to park their vehicles in the Controlled Parking Zone (Southall 2)  Reason: In the interests of traffic safety, and to ensure that the surrounding streets are not subject to parking stress or danger or nuisance from inappropriate on-street parking or waiting as a result of the proposed development in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Document 3: 'Low Car Housing in Controlled Parking Zones'. | The development hereby authorised shall be fitted with the following crime prevention security measures:  -The external doors (including the fire exit door) and individual flat doors should be certificated to BS PAS 24-1:1999 'Doors of enhanced security'.  -All reachable windows should be certificated to BS 7950:1997 'Specification for enhanced security performance of casement and tilt/turn windows.  -All accessible glazing should contain one pane of laminated glass at least 6.4mm thick.  -Access control must be provided to each of the flats sharing a common entrance.  Reason: To ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements in accordance with policy 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note 8: 'Safer Ealing'.
